alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 3:44PM EST until March 13 at 11:09PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River. Eel River at Bowling Green. .Ongoing and renewed flooding will continue or develop along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers over the next 24 to 48 hours and beyond. River stages are rising again due to the one to over two and a half inches of rain received from Saturday night through this morning. Minor flooding is expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Newberry. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, County Road 550 S in Greene County begins to flood. County Road 600 W just north of the river flooded by possibly more than a foot of water for a short distance in Mary Long Cutoff Area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 18.2 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued by later this evening.
